definition: an imagined romantic relationship between two characters in fiction (or in real life) that one wishes for or fantasizes about (abbr. of "coupling")

sentences.english: This algorithm is appropriate to PTP trajectory and CP trajectory.
sentences.chinese: 這種算法對於PTP運動和沿CP運動都是適用的。

sentences.english: The effect of counterpoise(CP) correction method to the BSSE has been taken into account .
sentences.chinese: CP這種方法對於基組誤差修正的影響已經被考慮。

sentences.english: There is an increasing tendency of milk protein percentage with higher dietary CP levels, but is insignificant.
sentences.chinese: 乳蛋白隨着CP水平增高有增加趨勢，但差異不顯著。

sentences.english: The mood particle de C-selects a CP containing a Foc.
sentences.chinese: 語氣詞的範疇選擇包含焦點標記詞的CP。

sentences.english: We still see a version of CP violation.
sentences.chinese: 我們仍將看到違反CP守恆的現象。

sentences.english: Physics that goes beyond the Standard Model can generate additional CP violation.
sentences.chinese: 超越標準模型的物理可以產生額外的CP違逆。

sentences.english: Now specific therapy of CP is deficient, non-operation therapies are the main methods to treat CP.
sentences.chinese: CP尚缺乏特異性的治療方法，仍以非手術治療爲主。
